W.1,23rd October, 1968^ / ? / TELEGRAM MO. 1174 FROM SALISBURY TO FOREIGN and commonwealth OFFICEFollowing is text of aide memoire.Rhodesian Ministers have been considering the british governments White Paper which contains the statement of british proposals for a settlement0 It would assist them in their deliberationson these proposals if they could have the advantage of further discussions with Mr. Thomson, the Minister without Portfolio, who has been given special responsibility on the British side for the Rhodesian negotiations.Accordingly, they would welcome a visit by Mr. Thomson to Salisburyand they suggest that he might arrange to arrive here next Tuesday,The Prime Minister and his colleagues would be at Mr, Thomson1 disposal from Tuesday afternoon until Friday evening,Rhoaesian Ministers, however, feel obliged to say at this juncturethat they consider the British Governments proposal for a system of appeals in relation to amendments to specially handled provisions of theconstitution to be completely unacceptable in any form. Their objectionsextend equally to any other body, such as a Judicial Commission withinRhodesia; or the country5s own Appellate Division of the High Court of rhodesia, that might be offered in place of the Judicial Committee of the privy Council as a form of control over the exercise of the sovereigntyby the Rhodesian Parliament, Should it be possible to meet their objections to this main stumbling block, Rhodesian Ministers are confident that further discussions with Mr, Thomson could resultin agreement being reached on the remaining proposals on the Britishdocument,,
